keyMoments.title: Luffy Vows to Ring the Golden Bell
keyMoments.description: Luffy declares with fierce determination that he will ring the golden bell before Enel can take it away, despite being exhausted from battle.
keyMoments.significance: This declaration elevates Luffy's mission beyond simply defeating Enel - it becomes about honoring history, preserving truth, and fulfilling promises made 400 years ago.
keyMoments.quote: I'm going to ring that bell!

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Yo-Yo Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy debuts the Gomu Gomu no Yo-Yo technique, using the golden ball attached to his arm to propel himself through the air with tremendous force.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's ability to turn disadvantages into strengths, transforming the cumbersome gold ball into a tool for mobility and offense.

abilities.description: Luffy uses the golden ball attached to his arm to stretch himself far back and then snap forward with tremendous force, propelling himself through the air.

keyMoments.title: Raigo Technique Debut
keyMoments.description: Enel unleashes his most devastating technique, Raigo, condensing massive thunderclouds into an enormous sphere of lightning capable of destroying entire islands.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Raigo as one of the most destructive attacks in the series, demonstrating the terrifying combination of Logia Devil Fruit powers and technology.
keyMoments.quote: Witness the true power of god! Raigo!

keyMoments.title: Destruction of Angel Island
keyMoments.description: Enel's Raigo completely obliterates Angel Island, leaving only a massive crater in the clouds and countless casualties.
keyMoments.significance: One of the darkest moments in One Piece, showing Enel's complete lack of empathy and the series' willingness to depict genuine tragedy and mass casualties.

keyMoments.title: Plans Total Annihilation of Skypiea
keyMoments.description: Enel reveals his intention to create an even larger Raigo to obliterate all of Skypiea once he obtains the Golden Bell.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the stakes from protecting Angel Island to saving all of Skypiea, establishing Enel as an existential threat.
keyMoments.quote: Once I have the Golden Bell, I'll create an even larger Raigo and destroy all of Skypiea!

abilities.description: Enel condenses massive thunderclouds generated by his ark Maxim into an enormous sphere of lightning. When dropped, it creates a devastating explosion capable of completely annihilating entire islands.

reveals.information: Plans to destroy all of Skypiea after obtaining the Golden Bell

keyMoments.title: Reveals Golden Bell Location
keyMoments.description: Robin tells Wyper that the Golden Bell sits atop Giant Jack, providing evidence from Noland's log book to support her claim.
keyMoments.significance: Robin's archaeological knowledge bridges the 400-year gap between Noland's account and the present, providing the first concrete evidence of the bell's location and validating both Cricket's faith and the Shandians' ancestral mission.
keyMoments.quote: The Golden Bell sits atop Giant Jack.

reveals.information: Reveals the location of the Golden Bell based on Noland's log book

keyMoments.title: Learns Golden Bell Location
keyMoments.description: Wyper receives crucial information from Robin about the Golden Bell's location atop Giant Jack, though he is skeptical after 400 years of fruitless searching.
keyMoments.significance: After generations of Shandians searching for their sacred treasure, Wyper finally learns its true location, though the weight of centuries of disappointment makes him initially doubtful.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Grieves with Skypieans
keyMoments.description: Aisa shares in the grief over the destruction of Angel Island alongside Skypieans, representing the beginning of reconciliation between the two peoples.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how shared tragedy can begin to bridge centuries of conflict between Shandians and Skypieans.

keyMoments.title: Grieves with Shandians
keyMoments.description: Conis shares in the grief over the destruction of Angel Island alongside Shandians, representing the beginning of reconciliation between the two peoples.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how shared tragedy can begin to bridge centuries of conflict between Shandians and Skypieans.
